Breeding adult.description: Adult Little Gulls have dark underwings unlike the all-white underwings of Bonaparte's Gulls.

Nonbreeding adult.description: Nonbreeding adult Little Gulls have gray wings, whereas nonbreeding and breeding Bonaparte's Gulls have black-tipped primaries.

First summer.description: First-summer Little Gulls have the trailing edge of the wing tipped in white, not black like first-winter and juvenile Bonaparte's Gulls.

Juvenile.description: Juvenile Little Gulls have a bolder and thicker "M" pattern on the back than juvenile Bonaparte's Gulls.

Breeding adult.description: Black-headed Gulls have dark primaries as seen from below, unlike Bonaparte's Gulls, which have pale underwings.

Nonbreeding adult.description: Nonbreeding and breeding Black-headed Gulls have a reddish bill, whereas Bonaparte's Gulls have a black bill at all ages.

Immature.description: In flight, immature Black-headed Gulls have a less distinct "M" pattern on the wings than immature Bonaparte's Gulls.

Nonbreeding adult.description: Breeding and nonbreeding adult Black-legged Kittiwakes have a yellow bill unlike Bonaparte's Gulls, which have a dark bill.

Immature.description: Immature Black-legged Kittiwakes have a black collar on the back of their necks that immature Bonaparte's Gulls lack.

Nonbreeding adult.description: Ross's Gulls have a shorter bill than Bonaparte's Gulls. Nonbreeding adults have one smudgy spot behind the eye, whereas nonbreeding Bonapartes tend to have two smudgy spots, one behind and one above the eye.

First winter.description: From below Ross's Gulls have gray primaries, whereas Bonaparte's Gulls have white primaries.

Breeding adult.description: Sabine's Gulls have a black leading edge of the wing, whereas Bonaparte's Gulls have a white leading edge and black-tipped primaries. Also note the yellow-tipped black bill on Sabine's, but not on Bonaparte's.
